meanings.definition: A type of player piano that operates by means of a pneumatic or electro-mechanical mechanism.
meanings.sent1: The pianolas in the music store play songs automatically.
meanings.sent2: We enjoyed listening to the pianolas at the old-fashioned parlor.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to dance on the pianolas, thinking they were alive.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers moved over the keys of the pianolas like a skilled magician casting spells.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the pianolas filled the room, transporting us to a bygone era.

meanings.sent1: The pianolas were beautifully restored antique instruments.
meanings.sent2: She collected rare pianolas from different parts of the world.
meanings.sent3: The pianolas lined up in the museum looked like a colorful army of music makers.
meanings.sent4: The pianolas, standing silent, seemed to whisper stories of the past.
meanings.sent5: As the auctioneer announced the sale, the pianolas gleamed under the spotlight.
